newsitem.title: UK: Tomkins up, active after Kleinwort "buy".
newsitem.headline: Tomkins up, active after Kleinwort "buy".

text.p: Shares in Tomkins Plc rose in heavy trading on Thursday in continued reaction to a "buy" recommendation earlier this week from analysts at Dresdner Kleinwort Benson and ahead of results on Monday, dealers said.
Shares in the baking-to-engineering group were up 6-1/2p at 280 by 1617 GMT in active volume of 15.6 million shares, making it the most active stock in the UK market.
Earlier the stock rose as high as 282p -- its highest in three months.
Tomkins reports first-half figures on Monday and traders said there was vague market talk of a possible share buyback.

Last July the company posted a 6.6 percent rise in yearly pre-tax profit to 322.9 million stg and in September chairman Greg Hutchings told the company's AGM that order books were in aggregate higher than in the same period last year.
On Monday strategists at Credit Lyonnais Laing included the stock in a list of favoured UK shares for 1997.
